intro: Proselias reduncus, commonly known as the reduncus spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its production of a milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with small, green, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures, and are clustered in complex inflorescences. The species is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often storing water in its thick stems.
